answers.q: how many valence electrons does argon have
answers.a: Eight; its outer shell is full (3s2 3p6).
As food additive E938, it’s used as an inert packaging gas and propellant to displace oxygen in modified-atmosphere packaging and beverage/wine dispensing, helping prevent oxidation and spoilage.

answers.q: how many neutrons does argon have
answers.a: The most abundant isotope, argon-40, has 22 neutrons; natural argon also includes argon-36 (18 neutrons) and argon-38 (20 neutrons).
No—argon is nonflammable and chemically inert; its main hazard is oxygen displacement (asphyxiation) in confined spaces.
